name: Almond Oat cake with Candied papaya
description: My vegan oat cake with candied papaya is sure to satisfy your sweet tooth
recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup almonds (ground (can be substituted with cashews))
2/3 cup self rising flour  (Or all purpose flour)
1/4 cup raw sugar (the cake itself is mildly sweet since the candied fruit is very sweet)
1/8 teaspoon of cinnamon (cardamom, nutmeg, cloves powder)

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, add 1/2 cup warm water, flax, oils, vinegar, spices and sugar and whisk for a minute till sugar is well combined. Let sit for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, add 1/2 cup warm water, flax, oils, vinegar, spices and sugar and whisk for a minute till sugar is well combined. Let sit for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk all dry flours, nut flour, baking powder in another bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk all dry flours, nut flour, baking powder in another bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the dry ingredients and candied papaya in the wet mix. Mix till just about combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the dry ingredients and candied papaya in the wet mix. Mix till just about combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour batter in two 4 inch inch ramekins or one 7 or 8 inch round, greased or lined with parchment.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour batter in two 4 inch inch ramekins or one 7 or 8 inch round, greased or lined with parchment.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in preheated 360 degrees F for 40-50 minutes or until toothpick from the center comes out clean.(Smaller ramekins will bake quicker)
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in preheated 360 degrees F for 40-50 minutes or until toothpick from the center comes out clean.(Smaller ramekins will bake quicker)

recipeInstructions.text: Cool on rack for 15 minutes before slicing.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool on rack for 15 minutes before slicing.
